answer:
* Aircraft will need to be trimmed nose down because the weight is further back, resulting in the wing being further from its critical angle of attack.
* Aircraft is less stable
* Performance increases due to the low angle of attack
* Lower takeoff speed
* Lower stall speed, since there is more of a difference between the
angle of attack at cruise speed versus slower flight.
* More difficult to recover from stall  (will be harder to push the
nose down with weight in the back)

(Pilot's Handbook of Aeronautical Knowledge 10-2)
